model_input:

2. The Mentor has been guiding and supporting the Mentee in their work for years, which prompted the Mentor to reassure the Mentee that many students feel the same way and that everyone works at their own pace.

Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'College application stress', 'Related Summaries': 'Mentee shares feeling overwhelmed with the college application process, and Mentor provides reassurance and study tips.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Mentee: Mentor, I'm feeling really overwhelmed with the college application process. What matters is that you're putting in the effort and taking the steps necessary to reach your goals. ### Mentee: That's true. But I feel like I'm running out of time. The SAT is next month and I don't feel ready. ### Mentor: Have you been studying consistently? ### Mentee: Yes, but it feels like there's so much material to cover. ### Mentor: Remember to break it down into manageable chunks. Schedule study sessions and breaks to prevent burnout. And don't forget to utilize resources like practice exams and review books. ### Mentee: Thanks, Mentor. I appreciate your advice. ### Mentor: Of course, Mentee. And always remember to take care of yourself. A healthy mind and body will help you tackle any challenge that comes your way.' }
